name: divinely
content:
divinely adverb
(BY GOD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
by God or a god: The Copernican model postulated that planets move in divinely ordained perfect circles. He believed he was divinely protected in his escape.
More examplesFewer examplesShe once told a Times reporter her books contained hundreds of scriptures divinely revealed to her. She plays the title character, an other worldly young nun who becomes mysteriously - perhaps divinely? - impregnated.God could simply divinely illumine us with whatever knowledge we need.

divinely adverb
(SPLENDIDLY)
old-fashioned in a way that is extremely good, pleasant, or enjoyable: He was entranced by the sight of a tall, divinely beautiful auburn-haired girl. I think the colour grey is divinely chic and wear lots of it.
More examplesFewer examplesShe could sing, dance, and play the piano divinely.Reading his books is like eating a divinely sumptuous meal but never becoming uncomfortably full. We enjoyed a divinely delicious vegetarian banquet for lunch.
